revised_title: Resonant Scattering and Fluorescence of the 15.1 MeV Level in Nuclear Physics
tldr: The authors conducted an experiment to study the resonant scattering and fluorescence of the 15.1 MeV level in nuclear physics. They used a lithium metal target and a carbon scatterer to measure the resonant scattering and found that a substantial amount of 15.1 MeV radiation was produced. The results provide insights into the nuclear properties and help improve the understanding of nuclear reactions and spectroscopy.
